channel.title: Want to learn about modding
channel.description: Does anyone know where I can find some resources about modding? I want to make a few that make my job just a little bit easier (Kind of like Altoholic on WoW). Perhaps a map in the corner, etc. I can't seem to find any guides on the minecraft forums. So any resources you could post would be very hopeful.

item.title: Want to learn about modding
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:408966”]Basically lol, the ones who came before renamed code became popular. Depending on how intricate your mod is, you will want to develop your own classes as much as possible to create smaller chances that your will break compatibility with another mod.[/quote] i hated renamed clients >.<
{
if (“re”+9));
&also (runescape_server_files_are_not_real_Java_coding_its_spoon_fed_java));
}

Read full topic

item.title: Want to learn about modding
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:2, topic:408966”]There is no resource for modding minecraft. Its simply knowing how to read obfuscated code and such to find out what files do what. When Notch’s releases his API (nonobfuscated client souce) I am going to sign-up and hope to get a copy lol.

The biggest rules you are going to need to know if you want to become a modder:
[ul][li]Know how to recompile without needing anything but 1 java file[/li]
[li]Know how to solve issues when you have conflicting voids because of an obfuscated class (or voids within class)[/li]
[li]Be able to read and understand obfuscated code fairly well[/li]
[li]Able to keep the code clean and neat, as this is running with the game.[/li][/ul]

EDIT - This will help you when searching for a specific string or such. Its just the normal ‘z-filesearcher.jar’ with its case sensitive problem removed.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

If you need to know how to recompile without needing anything but 1 class file, or help on solving issues with conflicting voids (for example, try to compile my second skin mod and you will get duplicate void errors that I had to solve, without re-naming anything) feel free to shoot me a PM.[/quote]

I know how to do all those things. I have a client updater (kind of like what RS Bots use), and was planning on using BCEL/ASM to hook events and such.

I was just under the impression that Notch had released an API for such things. Anyways, thanks for the help.

Read full topic

item.title: Want to learn about modding
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Basically lol, the ones who came before renamed code became popular. Depending on how intricate your mod is, you will want to develop your own classes as much as possible to create smaller chances that your will break compatibility with another mod.

Read full topic

so basicly us old mopar’s will be the only ones who can mod proper :3
